Package gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class ConjunctionDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.ConjunctionDetection
  • public class ConjunctionDetection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static utility methods to find and interpret coordination in text.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Method Detail

      • identifyConjunctions

        public static void identifyConjunctions​(Document doc)
        Deprecated.
        Annotates all conjunction relations in the document.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document to annotate

      • identifyConjunctions

        public static void identifyConjunctions​(Sentence sent)
        Annotates all conjunctions relations in a sentence.

        Uses the initial dependency relations.

        Parameters:
        sent - the sentence to annotate

      • identifyConjunctionRelationsFromTransformation

        public static void identifyConjunctionRelationsFromTransformation​(Sentence sent)
        Annotates all conjunction relations in a sentence using its embedding structure.

        In addition to embeddings, it checks for semantic consonance of the potential conjuncts. It relies on embeddings generated by CoordinationTransformation, so the results may not be accurate if the sentence has not been transformed by this transformation.

        Parameters:
        sent - the sentence to annotate

      • identifyDiscourseLevelConjunctions

        public static void identifyDiscourseLevelConjunctions​(Document doc)
        Annotates inter-sentential, discourse level conjunction relations involving entities.

        It uses sections of the document and some basic heuristics to identify possibly conjoined items.

        Parameters:
        doc - the document to annotate

      • identifyDiscourseLevelConjunctionsInSection

        public static void identifyDiscourseLevelConjunctionsInSection​(Document doc,
                                                               Section section)
        Annotates discourse-level conjunction relations in one section of the document.

        Finds conjunction relations involving entities only at this time. It makes use of semantic group/type information and list/item structure.

        Parameters:
        doc - the document
        section - the section to annotate

      • filterByConjunctions

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterByConjunctions​(SurfaceElement coord)
        Finds Conjunction objects indicated by the textual unit coord (the coordinator).
        Parameters:
        coord - a textual unit
        Returns:
        the set of Conjunction objects, or empty set if none

      • getConjunctionArguments

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getConjunctionArguments​(SurfaceElement coord)
        Finds all semantic items that are coordinated by the textual unit coord.
        Parameters:
        coord - a textual unit
        Returns:
        the set of semantic items coordinated by the textual unit, or empty set if none

      • getConjuncts

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SurfaceElement> getConjuncts​(SurfaceElement conjunct)
        Finds all textual units that are in the same coordination structure as the textual unit conjunct.
        Parameters:
        conjunct - a textual unit
        Returns:
        all textual units coordinated with conjunct, or empty set if none

      • isConjunctionArgument

        public static boolean isConjunctionArgument​(SurfaceElement coord,
                                            SurfaceElement surf)
        Determines whether the textual unit surf is one that is conjoined by the coordinator coord.
        Parameters:
        coord - the coordinator
        surf - the potentially conjoined item
        Returns:
        true if the textual unit is coordinated by the coordinator

      • getConjunctSurfaceElements

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SurfaceElement> getConjunctSurfaceElements​(SurfaceElement coord)
        Gets all textual units that are in a coordination structure indicated by coord. If the conjunct refers to a complex semantic item with a predicate, the textual unit corresponding to the predicate is used.
        Parameters:
        coord - the coordination indicator
        Returns:
        all textual units in the coordination structure

      • getConjunctionsWithSemanticItem

        public static Conjunction getConjunctionsWithSemanticItem​(Document doc,
                                                          SemanticItem sem)
        Gets all conjunction relations from the document that include a semantic item sem as an argument or a predicate.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document with the semantic item
        sem - the semantic item, potentially in a conjunction relation
        Returns:
        the conjunction relation with the semantic item if any, null otherwise

      • getConjunctSemanticItems

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getConjunctSemanticItems​(Document doc,
                                                                             SemanticItem sem)
        Gets semantic items that are coordinated with or by the semantic item sem.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document with the semantic item
        sem - the semantic item, potentially in a conjunction relation or indicating one
        Returns:
        semantic items linked to sem with a conjunction relation

      • conjSurfaceElement

        public static SurfaceElement conjSurfaceElement​(Sentence sent,
                                                SynDependency synDep)
        Finds the coordinating conjunction that licenses the syntactic dependency synDep in the sentence sent.

        synDep is expected to be a dependency of type conjunct. If there are multiple possibilities, returns the one that is closest to the end of the sentence.

        Parameters:
        sent - the sentence
        synDep - the conjunct syntactic dependency
        Returns:
        the coordinator if any, null otherwise

      • conjunctionSemanticTypes

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> conjunctionSemanticTypes​(Conjunction conj)
        Finds the semantic types of the conjunction relation.

        If the conjuncts are relations or predicates, the semantic type is simply PRED. Otherwise, it takes the semantic types common to the conjuncts as the semantic type.

        Parameters:
        conj - the conjunction relation
        Returns:
        the set of common semantic types, or PRED if the arguments are relations or predicates

      • conjunctionSemanticGroups

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> conjunctionSemanticGroups​(Conjunction conj)
        Similar to #conjunctionSemanticTypes(Conjunction), but checks semantic groups instead of types.
        Parameters:
        conj - the conjunction relation
        Returns:
        the set of common semantic groups, or PRED

      • semanticallyConsonant

        public static java.lang.String semanticallyConsonant​(SemanticItem a,
                                                     SemanticItem b)
        Gets the common semantic type (or group, no common semantic type exists) between two semantic items.

        PRED is returned, if one or both of the parameters are Relation or Predicate objects.

        Parameters:
        a - the first semantic item
        b - the second semantic item
        Returns:
        the common semantic type/group for entities, null if no common type/group

      • semanticallyConsonant

        public static java.lang.String semanticallyConsonant​(SurfaceElement a,
                                                     SurfaceElement b)
        Gets the common semantic type (or group, no common semantic type exists) between two textual units.

        Parameters:
        a - the first textual unit
        b - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        the common semantic type/group for textual units, null if no common type/group

      • conjunctsByDependencyPath

        public static boolean conjunctsByDependencyPath​(SurfaceElement surf1,
                                                SurfaceElement surf2)
        Determines whether two textual units are coordinated, based on the dependency path between them.

        They are taken to be coordinated if the path consists only of conjunct dependencies.

        Parameters:
        surf1 - the first textual unit
        surf2 - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        true if only conjunct dependencies exist along the path

      • potentiallyCoordinated

        public static boolean potentiallyCoordinated​(SurfaceElement surf1,
                                             SurfaceElement surf2)
        Determines potential coordination, based on the dependency path between the textual units and whether they are adjacent.

        It relies on #conjunctsByDependencyPath(SurfaceElement, SurfaceElement) and #mayBeContiguous(SurfaceElement, SurfaceElement).

        Parameters:
        surf1 - the first textual unit
        surf2 - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual units are potential conjuncts

      • mayBeContiguous

        public static boolean mayBeContiguous​(SurfaceElement surf1,
                                      SurfaceElement surf2)
        Determines whether two textual units are contiguous.

        Two textual units are contiguous if:

        • They are only separated by coordinating punctuations and conjunctions OR
        • If the intervening word has a conjunction dependency path with one of the textual units
        If there are intervening parentheses, the parenthesis content is ignored.
        Parameters:
        surf1 - the first textual unit
        surf2 - the second textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual units are contiguous
